subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A skeptic blog/article.
author: Eric VanDuzer
full_text:
Well April I guess we agree to disagree.  I feel that is what is great about
this community.  Each of us has our own opinions.  I just only hope that you
can respect mine as I do yours.  Healthly debates are good.  I just feel
that some people just need a little direction as I did.  To me in the end it
yes it does just and feul to the fire.  Isn't that how we change peoples
minds, by debating our opinions.  I mean, I would have never found this
place if it wasn't for a debate on another site.  All Frank is doing is
standing up for what he (and we) believe in.  Thank you Frank


On Tue, Apr 28, 2009 at 4:14 PM, April Abercrombie <
april@...> wrote:

>
>
>  These people and people like them don't matter. The ones that will be
> swayed without looking into all the facts aren't your friends anyway.
> Getting into petty arguments with these people just brings you down to their
> level. You look far more credible if you don't even give them any heed.
> People who are worthy of your energy and really want to know the truth
> will look at both sides objectively. They will come to the source, as I
> have.
>
> In the end, it will only cause more problems for you if you engage these
> types.
>
> Besides that, who cares what ANYONE thinks? Who cares who sways who? Frank
> should be doing this for himself first and foremost. He is not going to be
> able to prove his recordings scientifically, so why bother to compete? All
> he needs to do is prove them to himself.
>
> It is a total different thing to try and debunk evidence to actually prove
> something. The skeptic debunks things so that he may be left with true
> proof.
>
> That is not what these debunkers do. These guys say everything is
> a debunked, without ever really testing.
>
> You are always willing to test new theories and technologies to really see
> the truth of it yourself. This is why you are not a debunker. If you were a
> debunker, you wouldn't even try.
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> *From:* Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@...>
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> *Sent:* Tuesday, April 28, 2009 1:38 PM
> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] A skeptic blog/article.
>
>  Honestly Frank I say slap too.  I know that I am not very active in this
> group but I do read everything.  To me that was a pure attack.  Yes they are
> debunkers and they won't believe anything, but if you don't say anything and
> just back down there is that one person out there that will be swayed they
> way of the skeptic and will not here our side.  Slap away and let us be
> heard and get our opinions and beliefs out there.  If it touches one person
> (Like me I used to be one of those "debunkers" then I heard the stuff that
> comes through ITC and EVP research) it is worth the carpal tunnel.  And to
> add I am a investigator who still uses a debunking aspect toward the
> investigation,  but I am also a researcher and if there is something new out
> there I am always willing to test it and see what comes through.
>
> On Tue, Apr 28, 2009 at 3:17 PM, Fransen, Debbie <debbie.fransen@...
> > wrote:
>
>>
>>
>>  YES, yes I do.........LMAO
>>

>> Behalf Of *April Abercrombie
>> *Sent:* Tuesday, April 28, 2009 2:26 PM

>> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] A skeptic blog/article.
>>
>>   The problem with that Frank, is that it is a never ending battle and in
>> the end, you can't win because nothing you do or say will change them. I
>> just ends up causing you more grief.
>>
>>
>> ----- Original Message -----
>> *From:* Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
>> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>> *Sent:* Tuesday, April 28, 2009 12:23 PM
>> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] A skeptic blog/article.
>>
>>  Well, when these jerks slap me, I'm gonna slap back.
>>
>>  F-S
>>
>> On Tue, Apr 28, 2009 at 9:58 AM, April Abercrombie <
>> april@...> wrote:
>>
>>>
>>>
>>>  Not even worth wasting your carpal tunnel on that. The guy is a
>>> debunker, not a skeptic. It won't matter what evidence or argument you pose,
>>> he, and people like him will never believe it. They are just as bad as
>>> people who believe in everything blindly.
>>>
>>> A true skeptic remains unbiased-either way, until such a time as
>>> something is proven 100% either way.
>>>
>>> April
>>>
>>>
>>> ----- Original Message -----
>>> *From:* Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
>>> *To:* evp-itc@yahoogroups.com ; grassharp@yahoogroups.com
>>> *Sent:* Monday, April 27, 2009 7:10 PM
>>> *Subject:* [EVP-ITC] A skeptic blog/article.
>>>
>>>  http://skepticblog.org/2009/04/25/box-of-fiends/#more-2199
>>>
>>>  Of course, I had to comment.
>>>
>>>  F-S
>>>
>>>
>>
>   
>
